poem:
**Ascent of a Carrier**  

Once grounded in scandal's shadow,  
Qantas ascends, determined in its flight,  
a phoenix with wings dipped in morning sun,  
climbing ten tiers of cloud and time.  
Past turbulence, whispers of trust return,  
passengers soaring on faith renewed—  
the sky, now less turbulent,  
awaits another dance of ascent.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Qantas rebounds from worst-ever performance to be named world’s 14th best airline in ranking Qantas has rebounded from its worst-ever performance in the aviation industry’s annual awards to be named the world’s 14th best airline, after the national carrier’s reputation was badly damaged by a string of scandals during the pandemic. The national carrier climbed 10 spots in the 2025 Skytrax World Airline awards from its nadir of 24th place in 2024, after customers across". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
